tasks: Create a list of 10 potential user personas for an e-commerce website, using the 'Jobs-to-be-Done' framework to inform their characteristics and motivations.
Develop a simple decision tree to help you identify potential pain points in your own design process, focusing on areas where you struggle with User Research & Validation.
Write down 5 specific examples of how you've applied Occam's Razor in previous design projects, highlighting the benefits it brought to the outcome.
Conduct a usability test on your own portfolio website, identifying at least 3 areas where users are getting stuck or experiencing friction. Use these insights to inform a redesign of those sections.
Create a simple user journey map for a hypothetical product feature, using the 'Aesthetic-Usability Effect' principles to guide your design decisions.
Develop a basic prototype of an error state for a login form, using 10 Usability Heuristics as a reference point. Document your thought process and design choices.
Write a short essay (approx. 250-300 words) explaining how you would apply Miller's Law to optimize the navigation of an e-commerce website, including specific examples and design decisions.
Create a list of 5 potential user research questions for a hypothetical product feature, using the 'Laws of UX' principles to guide your question development.
Develop a basic wireframe of a hypothetical product feature, focusing on how it meets the needs of users with disabilities. Document your design choices and accessibility considerations.
Conduct a user interview with someone from your target audience, using the 'Jobs-to-be-Done' framework to guide your questions and ensure you're understanding their motivations and pain points.
Create a comprehensive design strategy document for an e-commerce website, outlining how you would apply the principles of Product Thinking & Strategy to inform every aspect of the design process.
Develop a final capstone project that demonstrates your mastery of User Research & Validation, including a written report and visual presentation of your findings.

resources.readup: As a UX practitioner, your skills are a great foundation for growth. Focus on developing your product thinking and strategy skills to elevate your practice and drive meaningful user experiences.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Applying Occam's Razor for Simplified UI Design
topics.summary: Mastering Occam's Razor will help you create intuitive and efficient user interfaces by eliminating unnecessary complexity.
practice_points: Analyze 3 existing products and identify areas where Occam's Razor can be applied to simplify their UI design. Document your findings and propose simplified solutions.

topics.name: Conducting User Research with the Jobs-to-be-Done Framework
topics.summary: Using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework will help you gain a deeper understanding of users' motivations and behaviors, leading to more effective design solutions.

topics.name: Creating Visual Hierarchy with Aesthetic-Usability Effect
topics.summary: Understanding the aesthetic-usability effect will help you create visually appealing and user-friendly designs that guide users through your product.
